physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initial case: Chest pain and near syncope; Computed tomography pulmonary angiography shows saddle pulmonary embolus. Second case: New dyspnea and left calf pain; Imaging reveals bilateral pulmonary emboli and acute left leg deep vein thrombosis. Laboratory analysis shows reduced hemoglobin (11.4 g/dL), increased red blood cell distribution width (18.9%), and mild thrombocytopenia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Case 1 progressed to a diagnosis of novel inherited type I antithrombin deficiency. Case 2 displayed increased thyroid-stimulating hormone and thyroid peroxidase antibodies, consistent with incipient hypothyroidism from Hashimoto thyroiditis; laboratory results normalized after treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: In case 1, plasma antithrombin activity was reduced (46%) and antigen (41%), consistent with type I antithrombin deficiency. In case 2, sensitive thyroid-stimulating hormone was increased (6.6 mIU/L) and methylmalonic acid was increased (19 nmol/mL).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After treatment in case 2, repeat plasma homocysteine and thyroid-stimulating hormone were normal.
